h3.a: Vacancy on the Rose Hill Historical Society Board - Applications Accepted

div.h4: Applications must be received by Monday, May 4, 2020

div.p: The Rose Hill HistoricalÂ Society's tax revenue comes from those residents who live within theÂ Rose Hill School District'sÂ boundaries.Â Â

Under this revenue umbrella the Historical Society Board structure will consist of 5 members:Â 4 of which are appointed by the School District and the 5th position is appointed by the other 4 Historical Society board members.Â Â
A vacancy exists by reason of expired term. PositionÂ #4 is a four-year term.Â

An application isÂ available by "clicking here," or at the Schools Administrative Center at 104 N Rose Hill Road. Â Applications must be received by Monday,Â May 4, 2020Â and may be returned to School Board Clerk Debra CrislerÂ by email atÂ dcrisler@usd394.com or dropped off at 104 North Rose Hill Road, Rose Hill, KS 67133 (please use the drop slot near the front door) during business hours M-F, 7:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.
Interested applicants may also call 776-3300 for more information.Â

District Education Plan: Â A parent survey was conducted, teachers will make weekly contact with students/parents, there has been a district-wide exchange of personal locker items and return of district property, and technology devices have been picked up. Â Grading will be based on completion of critical standards.
Support staff are available. If you or you child is having trouble understanding or completing class work . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Here to Help

div.p:
This message is to communicate the most current information regarding how the Corona Virus will impact schools as we move forward.
At 4:25PM today {March 17th, 2020}, Governor Laura Kelly announced that Kansas schools will be required to close their campuses to students, for the remainder of the 2019/2020 school year. Permission for small group instruction may come later. This includes all practices and school . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about COVID-19 Virus Information

li.a: Twitter
Facebook

div.p:
At the April 2010 Board of Education meeting, the Rose Hill School Board approved a "Pay to Participate" proposal as part of the budget reduction efforts the district was forced to impose to adjust to the reduced State funding levels. Â The approved proposal includes a one time annual fee students would pay to participate on athletic teams at the high school and middle school and activity teams at the high school. Â Refunds are provided if the student is cut from the athletic/activity team and does not participate in any other extracurricular activity or moves out of the district prior to attending a practice date.
Â
High School Students
$70/Year for athletic/activity teamsÂ
OR Â
$25/Year for Activity Teams (Debate, Forensics, BEST, Scholars Bowl)
Â
Middle School Students
$30/Year for Athletic Teams
Â
(A $150 maximum charge per family)

a.aria-label: Read more about Pay to Participate
